name: Ribby Hall Village Self Catering Accommodation

reviews.text: Accommodation was pretty good, clean, to a reasonable standard and quite new. However there's just not much to do here. Climbing wall @ £5 for 3 mins ! And no bowling alley. Also we took our bikes and there's no where to cycle on the site. The fact cars are allowed to drive round at all times (unlike Center Parcs) was pretty annoying as they never give pedestrians a 2nd thought, so not very child friendly in that respect. Food in café was pretty poor.
reviews.title: Nice Accom, but

reviews.text: We had been looking for holiday accommodation near Blackpool to replace where we normally stay as it had closed down and what a gem we found in Ribby Hall Village. It is everything you could wish for, for a family holiday. There is plenty to do on site, swimming, horse riding, climbing etc and a good entertainment club for the evening. The Village is well laid out and is well looked after. The standard of accommodation is fantastic, well above the usual self catering standard and there were lots of places to eat on site. The staff were friendly and very helpful. It is well placed for exploring the area if you want to. We will definitely be going back again and again.
reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic place to stay

reviews.text: We (Mum, Dad and 5 year old) went to Ribby Hall Village with another couple with small children just at the end of the summer hols. We had a fantastic time and everyone enjoyed their time there. The location is fab, it took us 15 mins to get to Blackpool Zoo and about the same to get to the beach at St Annes. We ate in the Bar and Grill where the food and service were both lovely. We stayed for the entertain one night, which was fine for two 5 year olds but possibly a bit lacking for older children. I believe there is also daytime entertainment for children but we didn't bother with this. The pool/changing area was clean and well staffed with lifeguards. A few of us did horseriding which was fun aswell.
reviews.title: Good location with nice clean, well equipped cottages. A lovely laid back atmosphere...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cottages were really clean, well laid out and well equipped for eating in. There is a lot of open space at the back for kids to run around safely with patio table and chairs.
reviews.title: Had a fantastic time in Ribby.. and more than once too!

reviews.text: We had a lovely weekend and will definitely be booking again...
reviews.title: Excellent accommodation in beautiful surroundings - perfect for families requiring lots of activities on site

reviews.text: This was a Gran and Grandad's treat for our son his wife and 2 children 4 & 2, the house was ready early so we were able to move straight in when we arrived. the house was in first class order, with all the equipment you could need. we all agreed that the beds were really comfortable. the food in the bar/grill was OK in the shop restaurant the food was very good. Swimming pool very good for young children. The highlight was taking my 4 year old grandson fishing for the first time he had a wonderful time in the space of an hour he must have caught 10 - 15 fish. I'm sure we will all be going again.
reviews.title: Ideal for young children

reviews.text: As a family we stayed in the Ribby Hall Village and stayed in the PIne Lodges what a fantastic place the bungalows are fantasic too, the accommodation was first class, so clean and tidy just like home from home. Close so Blackpool you can go into Blackpool by car in about 10 minutes so easy to find and can catch a local bus right at the resport opening. Have booked already to go back next year.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Resort

reviews.text: First trip to Ribby Hall and very impressed! Staff were very friendly and helpful on arrival and throughout our stay. The kids club was fully booked for the week when we arrived which was pretty disappointing - we werent told this might be the case - otherwise would have booked before we arrived.
reviews.title: pleasantly suprised - fantastic entertainment at night
DONT STAY AT THIS HOLIDAY VILLAGE!!
reviews.text: Our accomodation was newly refurbished as the website stated - it was beautiful - leather suite, fantastic stylish decor throughout.
Would not recommend the soft play - it was basically a free for all with little / no staff supervsion and 12 year old kids and toddlers in the mix.
reviews.title: You would think you were abroad, Riby Hall is absolutely fantastic!

reviews.text: Our weekend break at Ribbyhall Village was perfect for our family of 4, our 2 young children loved the swimming pool with flumes and the outdoor play park , indoor soft play area and mini golf. Our accommodation the Ribby Lavender cottage was perfect ! We had a spacious grass area with picnic table where the children could play safely. The accommodation really met our expectations in cleanliness, decoratively and location. The Village is a ideally situated to visit St annes-on sea and Blackpool as we did.
reviews.title: Relaxing family break at Ribbyhall Village

reviews.text: Stayed a long weekend in one of the Jasmin cottages, we were very disappointed that there was no washing machine or dishwasher especially for what it cost (almost £600)
reviews.title: The food on the complex was of a very, very poor standard & very expensive!

reviews.text: The first evening we purchase a Chinese takeaway from the Bar & Grill, to our disappointment it looked like something the dog had regurgitated & tasted equally as bad. All 6 meal were disposed of in the bin.
reviews.title: Fab family birthday trip to Ribby Hall!

reviews.text: The next evening we went to Papa Johns, we ordered 3XXL, 2XL pizzas, garlic bread & 3 salads grand total a jaw dropping £92, not brilliant, but the sea gulls enjoyed them immensely!!
reviews.title: Fantastic place for all ages

reviews.text: The last day we gave in & drove to Morrison's in Kirkham as the on site shop was very limited & yet again very expensive.
reviews.title: Building work at Hotel

reviews.text: This was a great family holiday with ages ranging from our 3 year old Granddaughter up to 74 years old .
reviews.title: That lovely feeling Holiday

reviews.text: Ribby Hall Village is a lovely place to spend a holiday, our Grandchildren enjoyed every minute of it, Adam, our 13 year old Grandson spent quite a time fishing, it was as if the fish were in a queue waiting to be pulled out, he no sooner cast out than a fish was hooked, he had a whale of a time.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay!

reviews.text: Our Granddaughter, April & Friend Helen, both 18 had a most enjoyable time. It is a comfortable place, Good clean accommodation, also a safe place for children to play.
reviews.title: You Have Got To Try This Place

reviews.text: My Daughter & her Family have been to Ribby Hall 3 or 4 times, my wife & I have been twice, I am sure there will be more times we will be coming back. Everything about the place is great, the staff are very helpful, the food in the Bar grill & restaurant is of high standard, the evening entertainment is the tops, the young ones really enjoy it.
reviews.title: Great Value, Very Clean Cottages, Childrens Entertainment Fantastic

reviews.text: Next time you are looking for a break away, try Ribby Hall Village, you won't be sorry.
reviews.title: Good family holiday

aka: Ribby Hall Village Self Catering Cottages Hotel
description: Lancashire’s Ribby Hall Village, is nestled in more than 100 acres of beautiful Lancashire Fylde countryside in the North West of England. Stay and recharge your mind, body and soul with a stay in one of our fantastic family self catering cottages.
